title: Supersymmetry of the Robinson-Trautman solution
abstract:
The Robinson-Trautman solution in the Einstein-Maxwell-$\Lambda$ system
admits a shear-free and twist-free null geodesic congruence with a nonvanishing
expansion. Restricting to the case where the Maxwell field is aligned, i.e.,
the spacetime is algebraically special, we provide an exhaustive classification
of supersymmetric Robinson-Trautman spacetimes in the four-dimensional ${\cal
N}=2$ gauged supergravity. The differential constraints that arise from the
integrability conditions of the Killing spinor equation enable us to
systematically reconstruct the metric. We derive the explicit form of the
Killing spinor either by directly integrating the Killing spinor equation or by
casting the solution into the canonical form of supersymmetric solutions given
in hep-th/0307022. In any case, the supersymmetric Robinson-Trautman solution
generically exhibits a naked singularity.
